channel.title: The march of medicine
channel.description:
Drama series highlighting important moments in medicine. Each program also includes a public service announcement related to medicine or hospitals.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: Dr. William Morton: The pain killer
item.description: This program focuses on the story of Dr. William Morton. It also includes a public service announcement by actor Robert Young.
item.dc:creator: WMAQ (Radio station : Chicago, Ill.)
item.dc:subject: Morton, W. T. G. (William Thomas Green), 1819-1868

item.title: Dr. Walter Reed: Yellow fever experiment
item.description: This program focuses on the story of Walter Reed. It also includes a public service announcement by entertainer Jimmy Durante.
item.dc:creator: WMAQ (Radio station : Chicago, Ill.)
item.dc:subject: Reed, Walter, 1851-1902

item.title: Florence Nightingale: The angel of the Crimea
item.description: This program focuses on the story of Florence Nightingale. It also includes a public service announcement by actor Don Ameche.
item.dc:creator: WMAQ (Radio station : Chicago, Ill.)
item.dc:subject: Nightingale, Florence, 1820-1910.

item.title: Dr. Fred Banting: A man with an idea
item.description: This program focuses on the story of Dr. Fred Banting. It also includes a public service announcement by Frank Sinatra, Jr.
item.dc:creator: WMAQ (Radio station : Chicago, Ill.)
item.dc:subject: Banting, Frederick Grant, Sir, 1891-1941

item.title: Louis Pasteur: The soft hearted man
item.description: This program focuses on the story of Louis Pasteur. It also includes a public service announcement by Eve Arden.
item.dc:creator: WMAQ (Radio station : Chicago, Ill.)
item.dc:subject: Pasteur, Louis, 1822-1895.

item.title: Greene Vardiman Black: The father of modern dentistry
item.description: This program focuses on the story of dental pioneer Greene Vardiman Black. It also includes a public service announcement by actor Tab Hunter.
item.dc:creator: WMAQ (Radio station : Chicago, Ill.)
item.dc:subject: Black, G. V. (Greene Vardiman), 1836-1915

item.title: Wilhelm Roentgen: The magic rays
item.description: This program focuses on the story of Wilhelm Roentgen. It also includes a public service announcement by Robert Q. Lewis.
item.dc:creator: WMAQ (Radio station : Chicago, Ill.)
item.dc:subject: Ro_ntgen, Wilhelm Conrad, 1845-1923

item.title: Dr. Joseph Goldberger: A simple kind of medicine
item.description: This program focuses on the story of Dr. Joseph Goldberger.
item.dc:creator: WMAQ (Radio station : Chicago, Ill.)
item.dc:subject: Goldberger, Joseph, 1874-1929

item.title: Joseph Lister: A passion for cleanliness
item.description: This program focuses on the story of Joseph Lister. It also includes a public service announcement by Gardner McKay.
item.dc:creator: WMAQ (Radio station : Chicago, Ill.)
item.dc:subject: Lister, Joseph, Baron, 1827-1912

item.title: Dorothea Lynde Dix: The do-gooder
item.description: This program focuses on the story of Dorothea Lynde Dix. It also includes a public service announcement by actor Dan Dailey.
item.dc:creator: WMAQ (Radio station : Chicago, Ill.)
item.dc:subject: Dix, Dorothea Lynde, 1802-1887
